t: Psalm 35
Of David.
Contend,*pn Lord,*s with those who contend with me; fight*ld against those who fight against me.
Take*ln up shield and armor; arise*ld and come to my aid.
Brandish*ln spear and javelin against*ld those who pursue me. Say*ln to me, “I*ld am your salvation.”
May*pn those who seek my life be*ld disgraced and put to shame; may*ln those who plot my ruin be*ld turned back in dismay.
May*ln they be like chaff before the wind, with*ld the angel of the Lord*s driving them away;
may*ln their path be dark and slippery, with*ld the angel of the Lord*s pursuing them.
Since*pn they hid their net for me without cause and*ld without cause dug a pit for me,
may*ln ruin overtake them by surprise— may*ld the net they hid entangle them, may*ld they fall into the pit, to their ruin.
Then*ln my soul will rejoice in the Lord*s and*ld delight in his salvation.
My*ln whole being will exclaim, “Who*ld is like you, Lord?*s You*ln rescue the poor from those too strong for them, the*ld poor and needy from those who rob them.”
Ruthless*pn witnesses come forward; they*ld question me on things I know nothing about.
They*ln repay me evil for good and*ld leave me like one bereaved.
Yet*ln when they were ill, I put on sackcloth and*ld humbled myself with fasting. When*ln my prayers returned to me unanswered,
I*ld went about mourning as*ld though for my friend or brother. I*ln bowed my head in grief as*ld though weeping for my mother.
But*ln when I stumbled, they gathered in glee; assailants*ld gathered against me without my knowledge. They*ld slandered me without ceasing.
Like*ln the ungodly they maliciously mocked; they*ld gnashed their teeth at me.
How*pn long, Lord, will you look on? Rescue*ld me from their ravages, my*ld precious life from these lions.
I*ln will give you thanks in the great assembly; among*ld the throngs I will praise you.
Do*ln not let those gloat over me who*ld are my enemies without cause; do*ln not let those who hate me without reason maliciously*ld wink the eye.
They*ln do not speak peaceably, but*ld devise false accusations against*ld those who live quietly in the land.
They*ln sneer at me and say, “Aha! Aha! With*ld our own eyes we have seen it.”
Lord,*spn you have seen this; do not be silent. Do*ld not be far from me, Lord.
Awake,*ln and rise to my defense! Contend*ld for me, my God and Lord.
Vindicate*ln me in your righteousness, Lord*s my God; do*ld not let them gloat over me.
Do*ln not let them think, “Aha, just what we wanted!” or*ld say, “We have swallowed him up.”
May*pn all who gloat over my distress be*ld put to shame and confusion; may*ln all who exalt themselves over me be*ld clothed with shame and disgrace.
May*ln those who delight in my vindication shout*ld for joy and gladness; may*ln they always say, “The Lord*s be exalted, who*ld delights in the well-being of his servant.”
My*pn tongue will proclaim your righteousness, your*ld praises all day long.
